Methods.Destroy: Marks the Object as "pending for destruction". This may or may not remove the Object from memory immediately, depending on whether the Engine is keeping a internal reference to it
Methods.Duplicate: Creates a duplicate of the Object
Methods.FindChild: Returns a child Object with the given name, or `nil` if one doesn't exist
Methods.FindChildWithComponent: Returns a child Object which has the given component, or `nil` if one doesn't exist
Methods.ForEachChild: For all children of the Object, invokes the callback. If the callback explicitly returns `false`, iteration ends early. Callback cannot yield
Methods.GetChildren: Returns a list of the Object's direct children

GetComponents.Description: Returns a list of the names of all Components that the Object currently has

Methods.GetDescendants: Returns all descendants of the Object (i.e. its children, and their children, etc)
Methods.GetFullName: Returns the full, hierarchal path of the Object

HasComponent.Description: Returns whether or not the Object has the given Component

Methods.MergeWith: Merges the Objects together, replacing descendants with the same name

Properties.Enabled: Whether the Engine updates and recognizes this Object, essentially freezing it if it is disabled
Properties.Exists: Whether or not the Object still exists. Will be false after calling `:Destroy`
Properties.Name: The name of the Object, usually what was passed into `GameObject.new`
Properties.ObjectId: The ID of the Object, an integer. Remains the same throughout the session, but not guaranteed between sessions
Properties.Parent: The hierarchal parent of the Object, or `nil` if it does not have one
Properties.Serializes: Whether or not the Object should be saved with the scene if it is serialized with `scene.save`, and whether `:Duplicate` will duplicate it (only applies to descendants)

Description: Represents an Animation
Not functional currently

Properties.Looped: Whether the Animation should loop when it reaches the end
Properties.Ready: Whether the Animation can be played
Properties.Weight: The influence the Animation has over the rig

Description: Represents a Bone of a Mesh
Created automatically when the asset of a Mesh component finishes loading

Properties.IsActive: Whether or not the Bone Object is actively affecting a Mesh
Properties.SkeletalBoneId: The internal ID of the bone, valid range is 0-126

Properties.UseSimpleController: Whether it is affected by the built-in controller (`W`/`A`/`S`/`D` horizontal movement, `Q`/`E` vertical, Mouse to look around)

Events.OnFrameBegin: Fires at the beginning of a frame, passing in the time elapsed since the last frame (delta time)

Methods.Close: Closes the application with the specified exit code integer or 0

Properties.Time: Number of seconds since the Engine started running

DirectionalLight.Description: Intended to model a large light source infinitely far away, like the Sun

Properties.Direction: The direction light is emitted from
Properties.ShadowViewDistance: How far back the shadow view is offset from the focus
Properties.ShadowViewFarPlane: The Far Z plane of the shadow view. Should be greater than `ShadowViewNearPlane`
Properties.ShadowViewMoveWithCamera: Sets the focus of the shadow view to be the Scene Camera
Properties.ShadowViewNearPlane: The Near Z plane of the shadow view. Should be less than `ShadowViewFarPlane`. Shouldn't be `0`
Properties.ShadowViewOffset: Offset of the shadow view from the focus, after `ShadowViewDistance` is applied
Properties.ShadowViewSize: Size of the shadow view. Sets `ShadowViewSizeH` and `ShadowViewSizeV` to the assigned value if they are equal. Is `-1` if they are not equal
Properties.ShadowViewSizeH: Horizontal size of the shadow view
Properties.ShadowViewSizeV: Vertical size of the shadow view
Properties.Shadows: Whether the Light can render shadows

Description: An example to be made fun of and bullied
The least-popular kid in school no one remembers the name of

Events.OnGreeted: Fires when `:Greet` is called, and sends the response to the callback before the original caller of `:Greet` receives it

Methods.GiveUp: Tells Engine-chan to kill herself and throws an exception
Methods.Greet: Says hello to the given list of names. If the second argument is `true`, does so extra villainously

Properties.EvenMoreSecretMessage: A secret message that's so, *so* secret that it cannot be read by Reflection-kun, almost like they're keeping a secret from her...
Properties.SecretMessage: A secret message that's so important it's read-only

Properties.Asset: The path to the underlying `.hxmesh` file, or a built-in identifier like `!Quad` or `!Cube`
Properties.CollisionFidelity: 0 - `Aabb`: An axis-aligned bounding box. 1 - `AabbStaticSize`: An AABB which keeps the same size as the Object
Properties.FaceCulling: An integer. `0` means no culling, `1` to cull its "back" faces, and `2` to cull its "front" faces
Properties.Friction: Fraction of Velocity it should lose per second while in contact with another object while `PhysicsDynamics` is `true`
Properties.Material: The name of the `.mtl` in the `resources/materials/` directory it should use
Properties.PhysicsCollisions: Whether other physics objects can collide with it
Properties.PhysicsDynamics: Whether the Physics Engine should apply forces to it
Properties.Tint: The Color it should be tinted with

Properties.Emitting: Whether the emitter should emit new particles
Properties.Lifetime: The X and Y components act as a range of how long any particle can last, in seconds
Properties.ParticlesAreAttached: Whether the particles are attached to and move with the emitter
Properties.Rate: An integer indicating how many particles should be emitted per second (must be above or equal to `0`)

PointLight.Description: A light source emitting light omnidirectionally from its `Transform`

Properties.Range: How far light is emitted. If `>= 0`, the Range is used and attenuation is linear, otherwise it uses the formula `F = 1/D^2 * B` to mirror real-world attenuation, where `F` is the final brightness, `D` is the distance of a point from the Light, and `B` is the `Brightness` property's value
Properties.Shadows: Whether the Light can render shadows

Methods.Reload: Re-compiles the Source file and runs it from the beginning, returning whether the compilation and initial run were successful

Properties.SourceFile: The File the Script is executing. Changing this to a valid File immediately reloads the Script if it is a descendant of the `DataModel` (i.e. `game`). To forcefully reload it, `:Reload` should be used

Events.OnLoaded: Fires when the Sound finishes loading, and whether it loaded successfully or not

Properties.FinishedLoading: Whether the Sound has finished loading the `SoundFile`
Properties.Length: The length of the sound in seconds
Properties.LoadSucceeded: Whether or not the sound loaded successfully
Properties.Looped: Whether playback should loop once it reaches the end
Properties.Playing: Whether the Sound is currently playing (or requested to play, if `.Playing` is set to `true` by a `Script` before it has finished loading)
Properties.Position: The time-position of playback in number of seconds from the beginning of the file
Properties.SoundFile: The sound file to be played
Properties.Speed: The speed at which the sound plays, within the range of 0.01 to 100
Properties.Volume: The volume at which the sound plays. Must be positive

SpotLight.Description: A light which emits in a conical shape

Properties.Angle: The Field-of-View (in radians) of light emission
Properties.Shadows: Whether the Light can render shadows

Transform.Description: Gives a physical position and size to an Object

Properties.LocalTransform: The Object's transformation, relative to it's nearest Transform ancestor
Properties.LocalSize: The Object's scale factor, relative to it's nearest Transform ancestor

Description: The Engine, for rendering and physics, will pretend the children of this Object's `Target` are the children of the node
This is *not* intended to act like a transparent proxy

Properties.Scripting: Whether Scripts which descend from the `Target` will run

Description: The container used for storing the main parts of a scene (3D objects)
If this is `Destroy`'d, the application closes

Methods.GetObjectsInAabb: Get a list of Objects whose bounds are within the AABB

Raycast.Out: { Object: GameObject & Mesh & Transform, Position: vector, Normal: vector }?

Methods.ScreenPointToRay: Converts the provided X and Y screen coordinates to a world-space vector, with the length provided or `1` by default

SceneCamera.Description: The `Camera` the Player sees the world through. If set to `nil`, a *fallback* is created at the origin

Description: Returns a Color with the provided R, G, and B values
Values are expected to be in the range 0 to 1
new.In: R: number, G: number, B: number

:Disconnect.Description: Disconnects the Connection, causing the callback to no longer be invoked. May only be called once

Connected.Description: Whether the Connection is connected or not

Signal.Description: The Event which `:Connect` was called upon to return this Connection

EventSignal.Description: An Event that can be connected to

:Connect.Description: Connect a callback to the Event

:WaitUntil.Description: Yields the thread until the Event is fired

Description: A Game Object
For organization, the members of this type will be on the Components wiki page

new.Description: Creates a new GameObject with the provided Component

validComponents.Description: A list of all valid component names which can be passed into `.new`

fromEulerAnglesXYZ.Description: Creates a Matrix which has been rotated by the given Euler angles (in radians) with the rotation order X-Y-Z
fromEulerAnglesXYZ.In: X: number, Y: number, Z: number

fromTranslation.Description: Creates a Matrix which has been translated to the given coordinates (specified as either a `vector` or the individual X, Y, and Z components)
Overloads: X: number, Y: number, Z: number

identity.Description: An identity matrix, the same value as what gets returned with `.new()` with no arguments

lookAt.Description: Creates a Matrix at position `Eye` oriented such that the `.Forward` vector moves toward `Target`

:__mul.Description: Two Matrices may be multiplied together with the `*` operator

Forward.Description: The forward vector of the Matrix

Position.Description: The position of the Matrix in world-space

Right.Description: The rightward vector of the Matrix

Up.Description: The upward vector of the Matrix

_VMNAME.Description: A non-unique identifier for the current Luau VM

appendlog.Description: Same as `print`, but does not prefix the log message with `[INFO]`

breakpoint.Description: Set a breakpoint at the given line

defer.Description: Schedules the given function or coroutine to be resumed some number of seconds later, or as soon as possible

game.Description: The GameObject acting as the Data Model of the Engine

Description: Like `loadstring` in *other* runtimes, however does not compromise Global Import optimizations and returns a coroutine instead of a function
If an error occurs, returns `nil` as the first value and the error message as the second value

loadthreadfromfile.Description: Similar to `loadthread`, however loads from a file instead of from a string directly

Description: The Script object the current coroutine is running as
In `require`'d modules, this is `nil`

sleep.Description: Yields the thread for the specified number of seconds

conf.Description: Internal Engine configuration state, loaded from file (`phoenix.conf`) upon startup

Description: Read a specific value from the configuration
Save the current state of the configuration to file (`phoenix.conf`), returning whether the file was successfully overwritten
Change a specific value in the configuration

engine.Description: Inspect and modify various parts of the Engine

Description: Returns the list of launch arguments given to the Engine
The first item is always the path to the Engine executable
Switches Data Models to the specified Object
Returns whether AABBs are drawn for all objects with collisions enabled (`.PhysicsCollisions == true`)
Optionally, the visualization can be enabled/disabled by passing in a boolean argument
Returns whether all visible 3D objects are being rendered with wireframes
Optionally, the visualization can be enabled/disabled by passing in a boolean argument
Shuts down the Engine and exits the process with the specified Exit Code (or 0 by default)
Returns what is currently selected in the Explorer
Returns the current framerate
Returns whether or not the window is currently fullscreened
To *set* whether the window is fullscreened, use `.setfullscreen`
Returns whether the Engine is currently in fullscreen
Returns the current framerate cap
Returns the list of valid tool names which can be passed into `.settoolenabled` and `.istoolenabled`
Returns whether VSync is currently enabled
Returns the current size of the window as two integers
Returns whether the Engine is currently running Headless mode
Returns whether the given tool is enabled
If the given tool name is not valid, an error is thrown
Returns the current maximum framerate setting
To *set* the maximum framerate, use `.setmaxframerate`
Sets the time scale factor of the physics simulation
Pops the topmost Luau VM from the VM stack, causing the VM below it to be used for any Scripts resumed beyond that point
Pushes a new Luau VM to the Luau VM stack. Scripts resumed past that point will run in the new VM
The `game` and `workspace` globals in the new VM will depend on the current bound datamodel
Resets the state of the Viewport
Changes the Root of the built-in Explorer's hierarchy view
Changes the built-in Explorer's Object selections to the specified Objects
Enables/disables fullscreen mode
Sets the maximum framerate the Engine will reach before self-limiting
Enables/disables the given tool
Configures the Engine to act as though the Viewport is at the given position with the given size
Enables/disables VSync
Sets the size of the window to the specified two Width and Height integers
Shows a message to the player with the given specification
The returned number will be the selected option: `0` for Cancel/No, `1` for Ok/Yes, `2` for No in `yesnocancel`
This is a blocking operation and no scripts or other parts of the Engine run until the message is dismissed
Avoid using quotes (`'` and `"`) or backticks (`\``) in the `Message`
Returns whether the given tool is currently enabled
To *enable* or *disable* the tool, use `.settoolenabled`
Returns a list of valid Engine tools
Unloads the given texture from the Engine's cache
Returns the current size, in pixels, of the game window
To *set* the size of the window, use `.setwindowsize`
Copies the file/directory at the given path to a new path
Returns whether the operation was successful
If unsuccessful, an error message is also returned
Returns the Current Working Directory of the Engine
Defines an alias for the filesystem, such that `@<Alias>/` refers to `<For>/` to the Engine
Returns whether the specified Path refers to a directory
Returns whether the specified Path refers to a file
Returns whether a File Dialog is currently visible to the player and blocking any more file dialogs from being opened
Returns a table of all the entries in the specified directory
The keys of the table is the path of the entry, while the values are the type of the entry
`f` is file, `d` is directory, and `a` is all
Changes the meaning of non-qualified paths (e.g.: not beginning with `.` or `C:` etc) to act as aliases to the given path instead of referring to the CWD
Creates a directory at the given path
Returns whether a directory was actually created
Will return false if the directory already exists, but the error message will be `nil`
Prompts the player to select a file to open
Returns the list of files the player selected, or an empty list if the player cancelled the dialog
If the operation fails, returns `nil` instead
Prompts the user to select a folder
Returns `nil` if no selection was made
Prompts the player to select a path to save a file to
Returns the path the player selected, or `nil` if they cancelled the dialog
Reads the file at the given address, and returns the contents
If the file could not be read, returns `nil` and an error message
Removes everything at the given path
On success, returns the number of items removed
On failure, returns `false` and an error message
Renames the file at the given `Path` to have the `NewName`
Overwrites/creates the file at `Path` with the provided `Contents`
Returns whether the operation was successful
If `CreateDirectories` is `true`, will automatically create missing intermediate directories to the file
`ImGui::IsAnyItemActive`
`ImGui::Begin`

`WindowFlags` may be a combination of any of the following sequences, optionally separated by ' ' or '|' characters: `nt` (no titlebar), `nr` (no resize), `nm` (no move), `nc` (no collapse), `ns` (no saved settings), `ni` (no interact), `h` (horizontal scrolling)
`ImGui::BeginChild`

`ChildFlags` may be a combination of any of the following sequences, optionally separated by ' ' or '|' characters: `b` (borders), `wp` (always use window padding), `rx` (resize X), `ry` (resize Y), `ax` (auto resize X), `ay` (auto resize Y), `f` (frame style)

`WindowFlags` may be a combination of any of the following sequences, optionally separated by ' ' or '|' characters: `nt` (no titlebar), `nr` (no resize), `nm` (no move), `nc` (no collapse), `ns` (no saved settings), `ni` (no interact), `h` (horizontal scrolling)
Creates a Dear ImGui window which takes up the entire screen

`ImGui::Combo`. Returns the selected option index

`ImGui::EndChild`

`Color` is an array with 4 numbers representing R, G, B, and A
`ImGui::SameLine`
`ImGui::Separator`
`ImGui::SeparatorText`
`ImGui::SetCursorPos`
Sets the position of the Dear ImGui element cursor within the current window
`ImGui::SetItemTooltip`
Sets the width of the next item
`ImGui::SetNextItemWidth`
`ImGui::SetNextWindowFocus`
`ImGui::SetNextWindowCollapsed(!Open)`
`ImGui::SetNextWindowPos
`ImGui::SetNextWindowSize`
`ImGui::SetTooltip`
Sets the region of the window in which Dear ImGui windows can be docked
Reverts the region of the window in which Dear ImGui windows can be docked to the default settings
Sets the size of the current Dear ImGui window
`ImGui::StyleColorsDark`/`ImGui::StyleColorsLight`
`ImGui::Text`

`ImGui::CalcTextSize`
`ImGui::TreeNode`

Similar to `imgui.textlink`, however, will open the given URL upon being clicked
`Url` will be `Text` if not provided
`ImGui::TextLinkOpenUrl`
`ImGui::IsWindowHovered`
Returns the position of the current Dear ImGui window (`ImGui::GetWindowPos`)
To *set* the position of the window, use `.setnextwindowposition`
Returns the size of the current window
Returns whether the mouse cursor is current visible
To *change* the visibility of the cursor, use `.setcursorvisible`
Returns the current position of the player's mouse cursor, offset from the top-right
Returns whether Dear ImGui is using the player's inputs at all
Returns whether Dear ImGui is using the player's keyboard inputs
Returns whether Dear ImGui is using the player's mouse inputs
Returns whether the mouse cursor is currently visible
Returns whether the mouse cursor is currently restricted to the window
Returns whether the specified key (as lowercase, e.g. `'a'`, `'b'`, or by GLFW Key ID) is currently being pressed
Returns whether the specified mouse button (`l`eft, `r`ight, or `e`ither) is currently being pressed
Returns whether the mouse is currently restricted to the game window
To *change* whether the mouse is grabbed, use `.setmousegrabbed`
Returns the current position of the mouse
Sets the visibility of the mouse cursor to the specified value
Grabs/ungrabs the mouse cursor
Sets the position of the mouse cursor in the window as an offset from the top-left corner
setmousepos.Description:: Sets the position of the mouse in the window

Description: Moves the mouse to the given coordinates of the window
Encodes the provided value into a JSON string
Decodes the JSON string and returns it as a value
Returns the provided mesh data associated with the provided path
get.Out: { Vertices: { { Position: vector, Normal: vector, Paint: { R: number, G: number, B: number, A: number }, UV: { number } } }, Indices: { number } }

Description: Saves the mesh data at the provided path to a file
Associates the provided mesh data with the provided path
In: Data: { Vertices: { { Position: vector, Normal: vector, Paint: { R: number, G: number, B: number, A: number }, UV: { number } } }, Indices: { number } }

Description: Imports the glTF model at the provided path and returns it as a `Model` GameObject
Loads `GameObject`s from the scene file at the provided path, returning a list of the root objects or `nil` and an error message upon failure

save.Description: Saves the list of `GameObject`s to the provided path, returning whether the operation succeeded
